alert.note: Alert for Allegany; Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 18 at 5:56PM EST until November 18 at 6:15PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EST FOR NORTHWESTERN ALLEGANY AND NORTHEASTERN GARRETT COUNTIES... At 555 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located near Grantsville, or 9 miles northeast of Bittinger, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. I-68 east of Keyser's Ridge in Garrett County, MD and I-68 near and west of Frostburg in Allegany County, MD. Locations impacted include... Frostburg, Grantsville, Eckhart Mines, Mount Savage, Midlothian, Piney Grove and Jennings. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
